topic.title: Creating and Editing Profiling Condition Sets in DITA

keywords.indexterm: DITAProfilingCreating or editing profiling condition sets

body.p: In DITA, profiling conditions can be set both within topics and in maps. When set in a topic, they allow you to suppress an element (such as paragraph), step in a procedure, item in a list, or even a phrase within a sentence. When set in a map, they allow you to suppress an entire topic or group of topics.

section.title: Creating Profiling Condition Sets
section.p:
To create a new profiling condition set, follow these steps:
and go to Editor Edit modes Author Profiling/Conditional Text .
In the Profiling Condition Sets section, press the NewNew button.
Step Result: The Condition Set configuration dialog box is opened.
Condition Set Configuration Dialog Box
Condition Set Configuration Dialog Box
Configure your condition set as desired. The following options are available in this dialog box:
Name The name of the new condition set.
Document type Select the document type (framework) for which you have defined profiling attributes.
Use DITAVAL file Select this option if you want the Profiling Condition Set to reference a DITAVAL file.
Include the content matching the following conditions You can select this option to define the combination of attribute values for your condition set by selecting the appropriate checkboxes for the values you want to be included in this particular condition set. If you have defined a lot of profiling attributes, you can use the filter text field to search for specific conditions.
Shortcut key You can click the Choose button to open a dialog box that allows you to define a shortcut key for this particular condition set. You can then use that shortcut key anytime you want to select this condition set to filter content.
Click OK to confirm your selections and close the Condition Set configuration dialog box.
Click Apply to save the condition set. All saved profiling condition sets are available in the Profiling / Conditional Text toolbar drop-down menu.

section.title: Editing Existing Profiling Condition Sets
section.p:
To modify an existing profiling condition set, follow these steps:
and go to Editor Edit modes Author Profiling/Conditional Text .
In the Profiling Condition Sets section, the EditEdit button to modify an existing condition set (you can also use DeleteDelete button to remove a condition set or the UpUp and DownDown buttons to change their priority).
Step Result: If you use the EditEdit button, the Condition Set configuration dialog box is opened:
Modify your condition set as desired.
Click OK to confirm your selections and close the Condition Set configuration dialog box.
Click Apply to save your modifications.

section.title: Sharing Condition Set Configurations
section.p: Your condition set configuration can be shared with other users through a project file. If you select Project Options at the bottom of the Profiling/Conditional Text preferences page, your configuration is stored in the project file and can be shared with others. For instance, if your project file is saved on a version control system (such as SVN, CVS, or Source Safe) or in a shared folder, your team will have the same option configuration that you stored in the project file.
